title: Selena Gomez 'has fallen hard and fast' for The Weeknd | Daily Mail Online
text: Selena Gomez is in love. The Good For You singer, 24, has 'fallen hard and fast' for new beau The Weeknd, 26, and the relationship of one month 'is serious,' according to UsWeekly . The performers have been seen kissing and holding hands in Italy during a luxurious getaway that is costing them nearly $250,000, E! News added. Real deal: Selena Gomez is in love. The Good For You singer, 24, has 'fallen hard and fast' for new beau The Weeknd, 26, and the relationship of one month 'is serious,' according to UsWeekly Their love nest: The blossoming lovebirds touched down in the picturesque city of Florence on Friday and immediately checked into the Belmond Villa San Michele 'It's serious,' a source told Us. 'Selena falls hard and fast. She's even wearing his necklace.' Her last serious relationship was with Justin Bieber. As far as their trip, they are not counting pennies. The blossoming lovebirds touched down in the picturesque city of Florence on Friday and immediately checked into the Belmond Villa San Michele, a hotel known for its privacy, following a long-haul flight from Los Angeles, California. Picey: The singers have been seen kissing and holding hands in Italy during a luxurious getaway that is costing them $250,000, E! News added. Pictured Tuesday in Venice Tour of love: The chart toppers have also been seen in water taxis in Venice But the rooms aren't cheap as it's estimated it would have set them back between $3,000 to $4,000 per night for the private suite but, if they'd really pushed the boat out, they could have parted with as much as $10,000 per night for the luxurious Limonaia Villa, while the Limonaia Suite comes in just under that at around $7,000 per night. And it wasn't just their accommodation they failed to keep a lid on, as the loved-up duo made sure their getaway was jam packed with exciting activities and spent their first day scoffing delicious grub at the Trattoria Borgo Antico. They then stopped by the Accademia Gallery Museum, which costs approximately $50, but made sure they were given the special treatment by coughing up $239 each for a private tour of the sculpture art gallery.
